Leaderboards

OpenXAI provides leaderboards for systematic evaluation and comparison of explanation methods. Each explainer in OpenXAI can be thought of as a benchmark. For an explainer to be useful for a specific application, it needs to consistently perform well across multiple evaluation metrics. Hence, we group individual datasets and explainers in OpenXAI into meaningful groups, which we refer to as evaluation groups.

Method Feature
Agreement (FA) 		Rank
Agreement (RA) 		Sign
Agreement (SA) 		Signed Rank
Agreement (SRA) 		Rank
Correlation (RC) 		Pairwise Rank
Agreement (PRA) 		Predictive
Faithfulness (PF) 		Inverse Predictive
Faithfulness (PF) 		Relative Input
Stability (RIS) 		Relative Output
Stability (ROS) 		Relative Representation
Stability (RRS) 		Predictive Faithfulness Disparity Venue
“Why Should I Trust You?” Explaining the Predictions of Any Classifier (LIME)

A Unified Approach to Interpreting Model Predictions (SHAP)
12 20 54 6 9 3 5 3 7 4 9 12 NeurIPS'2017
Visualising Image Classification Models and Saliency Maps (Gradient)
21 60 50 8 7 10 2 4 9 3 4 7 ICLR Workshop'2014
Removing noise by adding noise (SmoothGrad)
90 45 56 2 4 8 1 3 4 6 2 2 ICML Workshop'2017
Axiomatic Attribution for Deep Networks (Integrated Grad)
23 21 32 9 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 ICML'2017
Not just a black box: Learning important features through propagating activation differences (Input x Gradient)
92 66 56 1 9 8 1 2 3 4 5 6 arXiv'2016
